perturbation.original_text: (iii) immediately prior to offering the Securities to persons in the United States, we had reasonable grounds to believe and did believe that each such person was an Accredited Investor, based upon a pre-existing relationship, and, on the date hereof, we continue to believe that each such offeree purchasing Securities from the Corporation is an Accredited Investor;
perturbation.changed_text: (iii) immediately prior to offering the Securities to persons in the United States, we had reasonable grounds to believe that each such person may or may not be an Accredited Investor, and on the date hereof, we make no guarantees that each such offeree purchasing Securities from the Corporation is an Accredited Investor;
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated that the agent believed each offeree was an Accredited Investor. The modified text removes that certainty by stating the agent believes the offeree may or may not be an Accredited Investor and offers no guarantees. This creates uncertainty as to whether the agent performed the necessary due diligence to ensure compliance with securities laws. The change in 'did believe that each such person was' to 'that each such person may or may not be' is a direct contradiction.

perturbation.original_text: (viii) the offering of the Securities in the United States has been conducted by us in accordance with the terms of the Agency Agreement, including Schedule A attached hereto.
perturbation.changed_text: (viii) the offering of the Securities in the United States has been conducted by us in a manner we deem appropriate, irrespective of the terms of the Agency Agreement, including Schedule A attached hereto.
perturbation.explanation: This change directly contradicts the original statement that the offering was conducted 'in accordance with the terms of the Agency Agreement'. By stating it was conducted 'irrespective of the terms of the Agency Agreement', the modified text creates a conflict. This could lead to disputes about whether the agent violated the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: (vi) the Agent represents and warrants that with respect to Offered Shares to be sold in reliance on Rule 506(b) of Regulation D, none of it, the U.S. Affiliate, any of its or the U.S. Affiliate's directors, executive officers, general partners, managing members or other officers participating in the Offering, or any other person associated with the Agent who will receive, directly or indirectly, remuneration for solicitation of Subscribers of Offered Shares pursuant to Rule 506(b) of Regulation D (each, a "Dealer Covered Person" and, together, "Dealer Covered Persons"), is subject to any Disqualification Event except for a Disqualification Event (i) covered by Rule 506(d)(2)(i) of Regulation D and (ii) a description of which has been furnished in writing to the Corporation prior to the date hereof;
perturbation.changed_text: (vi) the Agent represents and warrants that with respect to Offered Shares to be sold in reliance on Rule 506(b) of Regulation D, some of it, the U.S. Affiliate, some of its or the U.S. Affiliate's directors, executive officers, general partners, managing members or other officers participating in the Offering, or any other person associated with the Agent who will receive, directly or indirectly, remuneration for solicitation of Subscribers of Offered Shares pursuant to Rule 506(b) of Regulation D (each, a "Dealer Covered Person" and, together, "Dealer Covered Persons"), may be subject to a Disqualification Event regardless of Rule 506(d)(2)(i) of Regulation D and a description of such.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states that none of the relevant parties are subject to disqualification events with specific exceptions. The modified text now implies that some of the relevant parties may be subject to a disqualification event. This directly contradicts the original assertion, making the entire process uncertain and potentially non-compliant.
